meanings.definition: A person who leads or directs a group, especially in a military context.
meanings.sent1: The fuglemen commanded the soldiers to march forward.
meanings.sent2: The general was seen as the fuglemen of the army.
meanings.sent3: The fuglemen made sure the troops did not get lost during the night.
meanings.sent4: In the battlefield, he stood out as the fuglemen guiding his comrades.
meanings.sent5: The image of the fuglemen shouting orders stayed in their minds.

meanings.definition: A person who sets an example for others to follow.
meanings.sent1: As a fuglemen of honesty, he never told a lie.
meanings.sent2: She became the fuglemen of kindness in the community.
meanings.sent3: The fuglemen of punctuality was late for the first time.
meanings.sent4: Her actions served as a fuglemen for integrity in the workplace.
meanings.sent5: Being the fuglemen of hard work, he inspired his colleagues.

meanings.definition: A person who excels in a particular field or activity.
meanings.sent1: He was the fuglemen of painting, winning every competition.
meanings.sent2: She became the fuglemen of swimming in her school.
meanings.sent3: The fuglemen of cooking burnt the dinner by accident.
meanings.sent4: In the art world, she was known as the fuglemen of creativity.
meanings.sent5: His skills on the guitar made him the fuglemen of music in the town.
